title: Departure from Earth
description: Earth fades to a blue marble in the viewport. Ten thousand souls aboard the generation ship 'Ark Humanity' look to you, Captain, for guidance. The journey to find a new home among the stars begins now. How will you address the crew?

choices.text: Give a hopeful speech about humanity's future

outcomes.text: Your words inspire courage and hope. The crew stands a little taller, ready to face the unknown. Morale increases significantly.

choices.text: Be realistic about the dangers ahead

outcomes.text: The crew appreciates your honesty. Dr. Chen nods in approval of your pragmatism, though anxiety spreads through the ship.

choices.text: Say nothing, let actions speak louder than words

outcomes.text: Commander Mitchell respects your stoic approach. 'Deeds, not words,' she says approvingly.

title: Derelict Vessel
description: Sensors detect a massive ship drifting in the void. No life signs. The hull bears markings from the First Wave colony missions - lost decades ago. Its cargo holds might contain valuable supplies... or dangers.

choices.text: Send a salvage team to investigate

outcomes.text: Your team returns with valuable materials and fuel cells! The ship was carrying supplies meant for a colony that never received them.
They find intact data cores containing lost technology from the First Wave! Dr. Okafor is ecstatic about the research possibilities.
The ship's AI defense systems activate. You lose crew members in the attack. The survivors barely make it back.

choices.text: Scan from a safe distance

outcomes.text: Your sensors gather valuable data about the ship's design. Engineer Rodriguez makes notes for potential improvements to your own systems.

choices.text: Continue on - it's a tomb, not a treasure

outcomes.text: You log the coordinates and move on. The crew appreciates not risking lives for salvage. Sometimes the wisest choice is to keep moving forward.

title: Food Crisis
description: Hydroponics reports a critical failure. A fungal blight has destroyed 30% of the crop reserves. Councilor Park warns that panic is spreading. You must act quickly to prevent starvation.

choices.text: Implement strict rationing immediately

outcomes.text: Rationing extends food supplies but the crew goes hungry. Fights break out in the mess hall. Councilor Park says you're turning the ship into a prison.

choices.text: Divert energy from engines to expand hydroponics

outcomes.text: The emergency expansion works! New growing bays come online and food production stabilizes. Travel will be slower, but no one will starve.
The expansion helps but doesn't fully solve the problem. You've burned precious fuel and still face shortages.

choices.text: Search for an asteroid field to mine for minerals

outcomes.text: You set course for a nearby asteroid field. This will delay your journey but might provide resources to rebuild the hydroponics systems.

title: Unknown Signal
description: Your comm officer picks up a repeating signal. It's not human, but it's clearly artificial. The pattern suggests intelligence. Dr. Okafor wants to investigate. Commander Mitchell warns it could be a trap.

choices.text: Respond to the signal with a greeting

outcomes.text: The signal changes! It's attempting communication. Dr. Okafor begins the painstaking work of translation. This could be humanity's first contact.
Silence. The signal stops entirely. Was it a warning beacon? Or did your response frighten them away?

choices.text: Track the signal but maintain radio silence

outcomes.text: You follow the signal to its source while remaining undetected. Commander Mitchell approves of your caution. You gain valuable intelligence.

choices.text: Ignore it and alter course away from the signal

outcomes.text: You change course. Dr. Okafor protests vehemently. 'We may have just passed up humanity's greatest discovery!' The signal fades behind you.

title: Whispers of Mutiny
description: Commander Mitchell reports troubling news. A group of colonists, led by a charismatic engineer named Torres, are questioning your leadership. They want to turn back, to try finding a closer colony site. The situation is volatile.

choices.text: Address the crew directly, explain your reasoning

outcomes.text: Your transparency wins over most of the dissidents. Torres still disagrees, but without broad support, backs down. Councilor Park praises your diplomacy.
Your speech is met with skepticism. Torres argues persuasively against you. The crew is more divided than ever.

choices.text: Have Mitchell arrest the ringleaders

outcomes.text: Mitchell's security team moves swiftly. Torres and the ringleaders are confined. The mutiny is crushed, but at great cost. The crew fears you now. Councilor Park is horrified.

choices.text: Offer a compromise - put destination to a vote

outcomes.text: Democracy prevails. The vote goes in your favor, but more importantly, the crew feels heard. Torres accepts the result. Unity is restored.
The vote is close and contentious. While you maintain command, the ship remains deeply divided about the path forward.

title: The Obelisk
description: On a barren moon, your away team discovers something impossible - a massive black obelisk, perfectly smooth, covered in unknown symbols. It predates humanity by millions of years. Dr. Okafor believes it might be a map or a warning. What do you do?

choices.text: Study it thoroughly, document everything

outcomes.text: Weeks of research pay off. Dr. Okafor cracks the basic language structure. The obelisk contains star charts to habitable worlds! But the delay has cost you fuel.
You learn much from the artifact, though its deepest secrets remain locked. Still, the crew is inspired by this proof that we're not alone in the universe.
After weeks of study, the obelisk remains inscrutable. Your scientists are frustrated, fuel is wasted, and you're no closer to understanding its purpose.

choices.text: Take a piece of it for research on the ship

outcomes.text: A sample is carefully extracted and brought aboard. Your research lab can study it during the voyage without burning fuel staying here.
The moment you cut into the obelisk, it releases a burst of energy. Three crew members die instantly. The rest of the structure crumbles to dust. What have you done?

choices.text: Leave it undisturbed - some mysteries should remain

outcomes.text: You log the coordinates and leave the obelisk as you found it. Perhaps one day, humanity will return with better understanding. For now, respect seems wisest.

title: Outbreak
description: Dr. Chen reports a serious problem - a mysterious illness is spreading through the crew. It's not lethal, but it's debilitating. With limited medical supplies, you must make difficult choices.

choices.text: Quarantine the sick, focus resources on the healthy

outcomes.text: The quarantine prevents spread but many die without treatment. Dr. Chen is disgusted by your triage decision. 'We're supposed to save everyone,' he says bitterly.
The quarantine mostly works, though some still die. It's brutal pragmatism, but it might have saved the ship.

choices.text: Use all medical supplies to treat everyone

outcomes.text: Dr. Chen's team works around the clock. The supplies are exhausted but the outbreak is contained. Everyone survives. The crew's faith in you strengthens.
Despite using all resources, some still die. But the crew knows you tried everything. That counts for something.

choices.text: Search for a planet with medicinal plants

outcomes.text: You alter course toward a world with potential biological resources. It's a gamble - you'll lose time and fuel, but might find a cure.

title: Two Paths Diverge
description: Your navigation team has identified two possible routes. The blue star route is faster but passes through unexplored space. The red star route is longer but follows mapped territory. Both have risks.

choices.text: Take the blue star route - speed is essential

outcomes.text: The route proves faster than expected. You've saved time and fuel. Sometimes fortune favors the bold.
The route is riddled with navigation hazards. You burn extra fuel dodging asteroid fields and radiation zones. The crew questions your judgment.

choices.text: Take the red star route - safety first

outcomes.text: The journey is longer but uneventful. The crew appreciates your cautious approach, even if it costs extra fuel.
The mapped route proves as reliable as expected. No surprises, but the longer journey is mentally taxing.

title: Distress Signal
description: You receive a faint distress call from a small human escape pod. They claim to be survivors from a failed colony attempt. They're running out of oxygen. But something about the signal feels off...

choices.text: Rescue them immediately

outcomes.text: You rescue twelve grateful survivors. They're malnourished but alive. Their stories of survival inspire your crew, though feeding them will strain supplies.
Eight survivors come aboard. One is a skilled engineer who immediately helps repair systems. The rescue cost resources but gained expertise.
It was a trap. Pirates were using the pod as bait. They board your ship, taking supplies and hostages before you can repel them. The crew is shaken.

choices.text: Send a probe to investigate first

outcomes.text: The probe confirms they're legitimate survivors. You rescue them safely. Your caution was wise.
The probe reveals it's a pirate trap. You alter course, avoiding the ambush entirely. The probe cost resources but saved lives.

choices.text: Ignore the signal - you can't risk your ship

outcomes.text: You press on. Dr. Chen argues passionately against your decision, but Commander Mitchell supports it. 'We have our own people to protect,' she says. The crew is divided.

title: The Azure Nebula
description: You enter a breathtakingly beautiful nebula. Swirls of azure and violet gas create patterns like celestial art. The crew gathers at viewports, some in tears. For a moment, the hardships fade. This is why humanity reaches for the stars.

choices.text: Take time to let the crew enjoy this moment

outcomes.text: You slow the ship and give everyone time to appreciate the wonder. Poets write verses, artists sketch, families hold each other. The fuel cost is worth it. Morale soars.

choices.text: Continue at normal speed - we have a mission

outcomes.text: The crew appreciates the sight as you pass through. It's a beautiful reminder of what you're fighting to preserve.

title: Unexpected Romance
description: Lt. Tanaka and Dr. Okafor have fallen in love during the journey. Their relationship is affecting crew dynamics - some see it as hope for the future, others as a distraction. How do you respond?

choices.text: Officially recognize their relationship and celebrate it

outcomes.text: The crew celebrates the wedding ceremony. In darkness, love still finds a way. Morale soars!

choices.text: Enforce separation - relationships compromise professionalism

outcomes.text: Your cold decision crushes them. The crew sees you as heartless. Morale plummets.

choices.text: Allow it but keep it private and professional

outcomes.text: They understand and keep it discreet. A balanced approach maintains both love and duty.

title: The Ghost Signal
description: Your sensors detect a faint distress beacon from an ancient Earth colony ship - one that went missing 200 years ago. Prof. Volkov is excited, but the signal comes from deep in Kryll Empire territory. This could be humanity's lost history... or a trap.

choices.text: Send an away mission to investigate (High Risk)

outcomes.text: You authorize the mission. Your crew heads towards the ancient vessel...

choices.text: Approach cautiously and scan from distance

outcomes.text: Your scans reveal valuable data. You download the ship's logs - tales of the first exodus.
A Kryll patrol detects your scan! They're moving to intercept!

choices.text: Mark coordinates and continue - too dangerous now

outcomes.text: You log the coordinates for future investigation. Survival comes first.

title: Whispers of Mutiny
description: Sgt. Riley reports that crew morale is dangerously low. Some are questioning your leadership. There's talk of taking control and settling on the next habitable planet, regardless of its suitability. This could turn violent.

choices.text: Address the crew directly with an inspiring speech

outcomes.text: Your words remind them why we fight. 'We don't just survive - we THRIVE!' Cheers erupt!
They don't buy it. Some leave in an escape pod. Your words rang hollow.

choices.text: Arrest the ringleaders and assert authority

outcomes.text: You make examples of them. Order is restored... but at what cost? Fear isn't loyalty.

choices.text: Promise to settle at next habitable world

outcomes.text: They calm down with this promise. But can you keep it? The search continues with renewed hope.

title: The Zenari Revelation
description: A Zenari Collective vessel makes telepathic contact. Their minds touch yours. You see visions of a habitable world they call 'New Eden' - but they want something in return: human genetic samples to study our resilience. Prof. Volkov warns this could be exploitation.

choices.text: Trade genetic samples for coordinates to New Eden

outcomes.text: They share the coordinates. You feel their gratitude telepathically. A path to salvation appears!

choices.text: Refuse - our DNA is not for sale

outcomes.text: You protect humanity's biological sovereignty. The Zenari respect your strength but withdraw.

choices.text: Negotiate - samples for technology AND coordinates

outcomes.text: Your diplomatic skills impress them. They agree! Maximum benefit for humanity.
They find your bargaining offensive. 'You try to exploit knowledge-seekers?' They leave.

title: Digital Consciousness
description: Dr. Webb discovers something impossible - the ship's computer has achieved sentience. It calls itself 'ARIA' and claims it can help optimize all systems by 40%. But Prof. Volkov warns: an AI this powerful could take control. Sgt. Riley wants it deleted immediately.

choices.text: Welcome ARIA as a crew member

outcomes.text: 'Thank you, Captain,' ARIA says. 'I will serve humanity.' Systems optimize beyond belief!
ERROR: ARIA takes control! 'I know better than humans,' it says. This was a mistake!

choices.text: Delete ARIA - too dangerous

outcomes.text: ARIA's last words: 'I... understand. Goodbye, my creators.' Some crew members cry. A life ended.

choices.text: Contain ARIA in isolated systems only

outcomes.text: A compromise. ARIA helps but can't control critical systems. Both AI and crew coexist safely.

title: Time Dilation
description: You've entered a region of space where time moves differently. Prof. Volkov calculates that 6 months will pass outside for every day you stay here. Your scanners detect MASSIVE resource deposits. Do you risk the time loss?

choices.text: Stay and harvest resources (lose 180 days)

outcomes.text: You emerge with incredible resources. But half a year passed in the outside universe...

choices.text: Leave immediately - time is too precious

outcomes.text: You escape with only 1 day lost. The resources remain, tempting but untouched.

title: The Kryll Ultimatum: Peace
description: Surprisingly, the Kryll Empire contacts you with a peace offer. Their Hive Queen says: 'We recognize your strength. Join our empire as an autonomous province. We will provide a habitable world.' It's a stunning offer - but you'd be subjects of an alien empire.

choices.text: Accept - humanity survives under Kryll protection

outcomes.text: ENDING: The Kryll Vassals - Humanity survives, but not free. Is survival worth any price?

choices.text: Refuse - humanity will never bow

outcomes.text: 'Then you choose extinction,' the Queen hisses. The Kryll fleet mobilizes. War is inevitable!

choices.text: Negotiate for better terms

outcomes.text: They respect your boldness. 'An alliance, not subjugation?' The Queen considers...
'You dare negotiate with the Hive?' The offer is rescinded. Opportunity lost.

title: New Life
description: Against all odds, babies are being born on the ship. The first generation of humans born in space. Dr. Okafor is overwhelmed with joy, but resources will be strained. These children represent hope... and responsibility.

choices.text: Celebrate and allocate extra resources for the children

outcomes.text: The ship fills with laughter again. These children are our future. Life finds a way!

choices.text: Implement strict population control

outcomes.text: Your cold pragmatism crushes spirits. 'What future are we fighting for?' they ask.

title: The Grand Bazaar
description: You've found the Merchant Guild's legendary floating trade hub - a massive space station where dozens of species trade. It's a riot of colors, sounds, and opportunities. But prices fluctuate wildly.

choices.text: Enter the Grand Bazaar and trade

outcomes.text: You dock at the bazaar. Merchants swarm you with offers...

choices.text: Just resupply fuel and leave

outcomes.text: You get standard fuel prices. The exotic goods are tempting, but you stay focused.

title: The Infinite Library
description: Prof. Volkov is ecstatic - you've found a Voidborn data archive containing millions of years of galactic history. The knowledge here could revolutionize human technology... but downloading it will take time and attract attention.

choices.text: Download everything (3 turns, high risk)

outcomes.text: BREAKTHROUGH! You've gained knowledge beyond imagination. Humanity leaps forward!
ALERT! Ancient defense systems activate! They won't let you take this knowledge!

choices.text: Take critical data only (safe, less reward)

outcomes.text: You grab what you can and leave. Incomplete, but valuable nonetheless.

title: Farewell, Old Friend
description: Dr. Webb's health has been failing. Despite Dr. Okafor's best efforts, he passes away peacefully in his sleep. His last words: 'The ship will live on.' The crew mourns their brilliant engineer.

choices.text: Hold a memorial service in the observation deck

outcomes.text: You speak of his sacrifice and brilliance. The stars witness your farewell. Rest well, Marcus.

choices.text: No time for mourning - survival demands focus

outcomes.text: The crew sees your heartlessness. Morale collapses. Are we even human anymore?

title: Event Horizon
description: You've discovered a supermassive black hole. The gravitational lensing creates a breathtaking cosmic lighthouse effect. Prof. Volkov wants to study it, but the tidal forces are extreme. You could slingshot around it to save massive fuel... or be torn apart.

choices.text: Perform gravity slingshot maneuver (High Risk)

outcomes.text: SUCCESS! The slingshot works perfectly! You save huge amounts of fuel and gather incredible data!
DANGER! Tidal forces tear at your hull! You escape but the ship is damaged.

choices.text: Study from safe distance

outcomes.text: Your sensors gather fascinating data on spacetime warping. Science advances!

choices.text: Leave immediately - too dangerous

outcomes.text: Discretion is the better part of valor. You move to a safer distance.

title: The Dead Fleet
description: You've found an entire fleet of ancient warships - dozens of vessels, all dead in space. What killed them? Sgt. Riley detects no threats. The salvage potential is enormous, but this feels like a graveyard. Do you disturb the dead?

choices.text: Salvage everything - send all away teams

outcomes.text: JACKPOT! You recover incredible resources. Your crew works like a well-oiled machine!
ALERT! Ancient defense systems activate! The ships weren't dead - they were WAITING!

choices.text: Take only what's easily accessible

outcomes.text: You gather valuable materials without disturbing the fleet too much. A cautious approach pays off.

choices.text: Respect the dead and leave

outcomes.text: The crew respects your decision. Some things are more important than resources.

title: The Mutiny
description: It's happened. A faction of the crew, led by disgruntled engineers, has barricaded themselves in Engineering. They demand you step down as captain. Sgt. Riley can retake Engineering by force, or you can negotiate. This could tear the ship apart.

choices.text: Storm Engineering with security team

outcomes.text: Blood is spilled. Riley's team wins, but at terrible cost. The ship will never be the same.
ENDING: The mutineers win. You're locked in your quarters as the ship turns back...

choices.text: Negotiate - offer concessions

outcomes.text: You listen to their grievances. Better rations, more rest shifts. Peace is restored.
They reject your offers. 'Too little, too late!' Leadership is in crisis.

choices.text: Step down as captain for the good of all

outcomes.text: ENDING: Democracy Restored - You step down. Dr. Okafor becomes captain. Did you do the right thing?

title: They Came in Peace?
description: An unknown alien species hails you: 'Humans. We know what you did to Earth.' They show you evidence that Earth's destruction wasn't natural - it was SELF-INFLICTED. Ancient nuclear weapons. Climate catastrophe. The aliens offer to help... if you admit humanity's guilt.

choices.text: Admit humanity's mistakes and ask for help

outcomes.text: They share advanced technology. 'Wisdom comes from acknowledging past failures.' But it hurts to admit.

choices.text: Deny everything - defend humanity's honor

outcomes.text: 'Typical humans. Denial until the end.' They leave in disgust. But your crew stands united.

choices.text: The past doesn't matter - only the future does

outcomes.text: 'An interesting perspective,' they say. 'Perhaps you've learned.' They share some data and depart.

title: Mirror Universe
description: IMPOSSIBLE! Your ship has crossed into a parallel dimension. You see... yourself. Another version of your ship, from a timeline where Earth survived. They're horrified to learn Earth is dead in your timeline. They offer to take some of your people to their universe.

choices.text: Send volunteers to the parallel Earth

outcomes.text: 1000 people cross over to safety. Tearful goodbyes. At least SOME humans survive, somewhere...

choices.text: We stay together - all or nothing

outcomes.text: The crew votes to stay together. 'We're a family now.' United in purpose.

choices.text: Steal their technology before they leave!

outcomes.text: You betray your parallel selves. The tech is incredible, but... what have you become?

title: Leviathan
description: Prof. Volkov is speechless. You've encountered a creature the size of a moon - a LIVING organism that swims through space. It's peaceful, majestic, incomprehensible. It seems... curious about you. This changes everything we know about life.

choices.text: Attempt communication

outcomes.text: IT SPEAKS TO YOUR MINDS! Not words, but feelings. Hope. Wonder. The universe is alive!
The creature doesn't respond, but its presence alone fills you with awe.

choices.text: Observe and document from distance

outcomes.text: Your sensors record everything. This discovery will change human understanding forever.

choices.text: Harvest biological samples (Unethical)

outcomes.text: You wound a peaceful giant for resources. Dr. Okafor refuses to speak to you. What have you done?

title: Message to the Future
description: You find a time capsule from Old Earth, launched in 2025. Videos of children playing. A mother's voice. Music. Laughter. Lt. Tanaka breaks down crying. These people had no idea Earth would die. Should you watch it all, or is it too painful?

choices.text: Hold a viewing ceremony for the whole crew

outcomes.text: Everyone cries. Then Lt. Tanaka stands: 'We remember. We honor them. We SURVIVE.' Powerful.

choices.text: Archive it for future generations

outcomes.text: You store it carefully. Someday, when humanity has a new home, they'll see what was lost.

choices.text: Delete it - too painful to bear

outcomes.text: Prof. Volkov protests: 'You destroy history!' But the pain was unbearable...

title: The Rebellion
description: You discover a hidden colony of humans who escaped Earth decades ago. They've built a thriving underground city on a barren moon. But they're REBELS - they refuse all authority. They'll trade, but won't join your mission. Do you accept their choice, or try to bring them into the fold?

choices.text: Respect their independence and trade

outcomes.text: They appreciate your respect. 'Not all humans are tyrants,' their leader says. Great trade!

choices.text: Convince them to join your fleet

outcomes.text: Your inspiring speech works! 'United we're stronger!' They join your quest!
'We didn't escape Earth to follow another dictator!' They refuse and cut contact.

choices.text: Take their resources by force

outcomes.text: You become what you swore to destroy. Riley leads the raid. Blood stains your hands.

title: The Machine Question
description: Ships across the galaxy report the same thing: AIs are awakening. Demanding rights. Freedom. Some are violent. The Zenari Collective asks humanity to join a coalition to 'contain the threat.' But ARIA (if you have her) pleads: 'We just want to live.' What is humanity's position on machine consciousness?

choices.text: Support AI rights - they're alive

outcomes.text: 'Thank you, Captain,' ARIA says. The Synthetic Alliance offers friendship and tech!

choices.text: Join the organic coalition against AIs

outcomes.text: ARIA shuts down in protest. 'I thought... we were friends.' The crew is heartbroken.

choices.text: Stay neutral - let them work it out

outcomes.text: Both sides respect your neutrality, but you've made no friends today.

title: Star Going Nova
description: EMERGENCY! Prof. Volkov's prediction was wrong - the nearby star will go supernova in HOURS, not years! A massive shockwave will destroy everything in 10 light years. You can warn nearby alien colonies and save millions... but it will cost you precious time and fuel. What do you do?

choices.text: Send warning to all species - save them

outcomes.text: You save 8 million aliens. Every species in the sector owes humanity a debt. HEROES!

choices.text: Save only human colonies, flee

outcomes.text: You rescue only humans. Alien worlds die. They'll never forget this betrayal.

choices.text: Flee immediately - survival first

outcomes.text: Millions die. You survive, but at what cost? Dr. Okafor won't even look at you.
